text: The President of Guatemala () officially known as the President of the Republic of Guatemala (), is the head of state and head of government of Guatemala, elected to a single four-year term. The job of President was created in 1839. From 1821 until 1839, the head of state of Guatemala was styled simply as Head of State (). ==List of presidents of Guatemala== List of presidents of Guatemala ==Requirements to hold office== According to article 185 of the constitution, the following is required to be president: * A Guatemalan of origin who is a citizen in good standing. * Forty years of age. ==Living former presidents== File:Vinicio_Cerezo_2017.jpg|Vinicio Cerezo, 1986–1991 File:Jorge Serrano Elías 1993 (cropped).jpg|Jorge Serrano Elías, 1991–1993 File:Alfonso_Portillo_Cabrera.jpg|Alfonso Portillo, 2000–2004 File:Óscar_Berger_Perdomo_2005.jpg|Óscar Berger, 2004–2008 File:Pérez_Molina_cropped.jpg|Otto Pérez Molina, 2012–2015 File:Alejandro_Maldonado_2015_(cropped).jpg|Alejandro Maldonado, 2015–2016 File:President Trump Meets with the President of Guatemala (49235087891) (cropped).jpg|Jimmy Morales, 2016–2020 File:Retrato de Alejandro Giammattei, Presidente de Guatemala (2020-2024) (cropped).png|Alejandro Giammattei, 2020–2024 The most recent president to die was Álvaro Colom (served 2008–2012), on 23 January 2023, at the age of 71. ==References==
